description: On March 16, The Parliament of Moldova declared a State of Emergency allowing the government to impose additional border controls, limit movement, prohibit large gatherings, manage food supplies, and coordinate media messaging about the pandemic. It will end in 60 days.
date_end_spec: The policy has a clear end date

description: A state of emergency was declared in the Transnistrian region of Moldova. It will last from March 17 until April 5.
date_end_spec: The policy has a clear end date

description: A state of emergency was declared in the Transnistrian region of Moldova. It will last from March 17 until April 5. On March 30, it was extended until May 1. UPDATE: The state of emergency declared in the Transnistrian region for the period between March 17 and April 5 was extended until May 1.
date_end_spec: The policy has a clear end date

description: A state of emergency was declared in the Transnistrian region of Moldova. It will last from March 17 until April 5. It is extended on April 24 until May 15. UPDATE: The state of emergency declared in the Transnistrian region for the period between March 17 and April 5 was originally extended until May 1. It is extended for a second time until May 15.
date_end_spec: The policy has a clear end date

description:
The National Extraordinary Commission for Public Health in Moldova will declare a public health emergency on May 15. Through the platform of this commission, the sanitary-epidemiological rules will be further adjusted.

On July 24 the Commission extended the state of public health emergency to August 31. UPDATE: The original state of public health emergency was set to last until June 30, since that time the National Extraordinary Public Health Committee has extended this state of emergency twice, as of the committee's decree of July 24, 2020 the state of emergency will remain in place until August 31
date_end_spec: The policy has a clear end date
target_geog_level: One or more countries, but not all countries

description:
The National Extraordinary Commission for Public Health in Moldova will declare a public health emergency on May 15. Through the platform of this commission, the sanitary-epidemiological rules will be further adjusted.

The public health emergency has again been extended to September 15, 2020 by the National Extraordinary Commission for Public Health in Moldova. UPDATE: Moldova's state of public health emergency has been extended to September 15, 2020
date_end_spec: The policy has a clear end date
target_geog_level: One or more countries, but not all countries

description:
The National Extraordinary Commission for Public Health in Moldova will declare a public health emergency on May 15. Through the platform of this commission, the sanitary-epidemiological rules will be further adjusted.

This state of Public health emergency will now continue to remain in effect until September 30 UPDATE: The state of national health emergency has been extended to September 30 by the National Extraordinary Commission on Public Heath.

description: The National Extraordinary Commission for Public Health in Moldova will declare a public health emergency between May 16 and June 30. Through the platform of this commission, the sanitary-epidemiological rules will be further adjusted. UPDATE: The period of the public health emergency was officially set between May 16 and June 30.
date_end_spec: The policy has a clear end date

description: Moldova suspends air traffic with Italy as of March 12. The measure is valid until March 31.
date_end_spec: The policy has a clear end date
target_geog_level: One or more countries, but not all countries

description:
The air operators on Moldova are obliged not to allow travellers from Italy, China, Iran and South Korea from March 12.

The National Extraordinary Commission on Public Health eased restrictions by decree on 15 May, 2020 to allow passengers of any nationality transit through Moldovan territory on repatriation journeys organized by their home countries. As of May 25, 2020 The National Extraordinary Commission on Public Health have fully lifted all restrictions on passengers transiting Moldova. UPDATE: Restrictions on foreign passengers transiting Moldovan territory were fully lifted May 25, 2020 by decree of the National Extraordinary Committee on Public Health.
date_end_spec: The policy has a clear end date
target_geog_level: One or more countries, but not all countries

description: Air operators are banned from carrying persons of other nationalities than Moldovan to Moldova from March 13, except for stateless persons and foreigners with residence, domicile or with permit of stay in Moldova.
date_end_spec: The policy has a clear end date
target_geog_level: All countries

description:
The Republic of Moldova closes its airspace for the regular flights from Spain and France as of March 13. The Chisinau-Barcelona and Chisinau-Paris flights are also annulled.

Flights to and from all destinations are permitted to resume from June 15, 2020. UPDATE: All commercial flights in and out of Moldova to all destinations were resumed as of June 15, 2020
date_end_spec: The policy has a clear end date
target_geog_level: One or more countries, but not all countries

description: Moldova stopped flights at the Chisinau Airport from March 17 until May 15, at the earliest. This suspends all inbound and outbund flights from the country.
date_end_spec: The policy has a clear end date
target_geog_level: All countries

description: Citizens of the de facto Transnistria holding residence permits issued after June 3, 2020 who live in territory claimed by Transnistria, but currently under the administration of the Moldovan Government at Chisinau, must receive special permission to cross into Transnistrian territory from the Transnistrian Ministry of Internal Affairs' Operational Headquarters for the Prevention and Prevention of the Spread of Viral Infection. The areas subject to this requirement are:  the village of Varnitsa; the village of Kopanka, Slobodzeya region; the villages of Novaya Molovata, Kociery, Pogrebea, Dorotskoe , Koshnitsa, Pyryta, Dubossary region.
target_geog_level: One or more cities within one or more countries

description:
The government of the Transnistria region in Moldova have suspended the operation of all public transport beginning March 24. 

As part of the gradual easing of lockdown restrictions, public transport will be permitted to operate freely within the Transnistrian region beginning June 27th. UPDATE: On March 24, authorities in the Transnistria region suspended all public transport. On June 25 the COVID 19 task force of the Interior Ministry of the Transnistrian region decided that as part of the gradual easing of COVID 19 related restrictions, public transport services would be resumed in full beginning June 27, 2020.
date_end_spec: The policy has a clear end date
target_geog_level: One or more provinces within one or more countries

description: The health authorities of Moldova called on the population on March 10 who returned from countries affected by COVID-19 to remain at home for 14 days and not to go to health facilities, if they do not have health problems. From May 27, this is no longer valid for people transporting goods, students, and people traveling for professional or health interests. UPDATE: From May 27, the 14-day self-isolation regime for persons who enter the Republic of Moldova will no longer be mandatory for people transporting goods or travelling for health or humanitarian reasons, students studying at foreign education institutions, and persons who travel for professional interests.
date_end_spec: The policy has a clear end date
target_geog_level: One or more countries, but not all countries
